document_data.name: Fleetswake
document_data.mainbody: '''Fleetswake''' was a festival held in [[Waterdeep]] during the last [[tenday]] of [[Ches]]. It celebrated the sea and [[deity|deities]] associated with it, as well as maritime activities.
document_data.Description: The festival was dedicated to the sea itself, as well as maritime trade. Special respect was paid to all deities of [[Faerûn]] associated with the sea, navigation, and weather.
document_data.Location: Most of the event's festivities took place in the [[Dock Ward of Waterdeep|Dock Ward]], although taverns such as the [[Fiery Flagon]] in the [[Sea Ward of Waterdeep|Sea Ward]] also enjoyed intense activity during the holiday.
document_data.Activities:
The event's many activities included:
* Boat races involving private boats and the [[raker]]s of the [[City Guard (Waterdeep)|City Guard]]'s naval branch;
* The [[Shipwrights' Ball]] at the [[Shipwrights' House]], located at the corner of [[Asteril's Way]] and [[Dock Street (Waterdeep)|Dock Street]] in the Dock Ward;
* Galas at the [[Copper Cup]] festhall, located in [[Smuggler's Run]] close to the [[South Gate (Waterdeep)|South Gate]].
* The [[Fair Seas Festival]], held on the last two days of Fleetswake and characterized by the consumption of large quantities of seafood and the contribution of donations to [[Umberlee]].

During the entire event, ships were not charged the typical docking fees of the city, but their captains were expected to contribute with donations of at least 1 [[gp]] per day they remained docked.

All donations collected in the festival were then consigned to [[Umberlee's Cache]], a sunken treasure located in the deepest part of [[Deepwater Harbor]] that was fiercely protected by [[merfolk]] and surrounded by myths and legends.
document_data.History: Different versions of the festival were known to be held in Waterdeep's harbor since long before the founding of the city, when trading caravans started meeting in the location from {{YearlinkName|-1088}} onwards.
